Party?

Bar?

George?

You get the tickets?

Death Blow: When someone tries to blow you up, not because of who you are,
Kramer, do you know what I had to go through to get these?

No, I'm okay.
There's no problem, really.
I'm fine. How was the party?
Food was good.
So I didn't miss anything?
Well, actually you did miss one nugget of entertainment. Have you
Elaine danced?

Did she do the little kicks and the thumbs?
What, you mean you know about this?
For some time. It was about five years ago. I never knew what to say to her
Well, sometimes you can't help these people 'til they hit rock bottom.
And by then you've lost interest.

During that period when my folks were separated he went a little crazy.
Not a very long trip.
Brody's in.

Well, you better get on the horn.

Jerry, it's like the feeling is palpable. You think it could have something

Oh, it's George. I bet you this is somehow George related.

You have a minute to approve some copy?

Why? He seems harmless.
Oh he's not. He's very harmful.

Oh trust me. He's a bad seed. He's a horrible seed. He's one of the worst
And you two are friends?
Yeah, we're good friends.
So this Anna called me from out of the blue.

With extreme prejudice.
Maybe Elaine put in a good word for you.

Half of show business is here.

Hey Kramer. And you must be Jerry. Thanks for the ticket.
That's quite a feed bag you're workin' on there.
It's for all of us. Is there a problem?
Brody, c'mon. He's just kidding. He's a joke maker. Tell him, Jerry.
I'm a joke maker.
All right, here we go, Death Blow.
Hey, hey, what the hell is he doing?
Relax, he does that all the time.
Does what?
He's making a copy of the movie for sale on the street, huh?
May I see you outside for a moment please?
But I want to--
Outside!
Hey, have you seen Anna?
Uh, she just went to meet your friend George.
To meet George? I knew it. Where did they go?
The park, why?
Don't you see? George is in the bloodstream! You stay away from him, too!
What do you mean he's bootlegging the movie?
Well, it's a perfectly legitimate business.
It's not legitimate.
It's a business.
Where did you meet this guy?
He's a friend of a friend. You know Corky Ramarez up on 94th Street? One day he and I are playing Pinochle--
Kramer.
Man, we're missin' the Death Blow!
I don't believe this.
You know I'm not supposed to be talking to you.
No one's putting a gun to your head. Do I, uh, scare you?
No... a little. Nice car.
Yeah, she's a sweet ride.
Is that your orthopedic back pillow?
Maybe.
Well is it or isn't it?
Guess not.
Stay away from her.
I didn't do nothin'.
Get in the car.
But...
You heard me young lady, get in the car. And you, you should know better. I don't want you infecting my staff.
Lighten up.
Go get 'em, Death Blow! You okay?
Uh, I got a cramp.
Well, it's no wonder. You ate that entire bag of candy.
Uh, there it goes again. Kramer, you gotta drive me home.
Hey, what is going on over there?

Are you nuts? There's no way I'm holding that thing.
Jerry, if the man is in pain...
Yeah well, maybe if he didn't lick his fingers before he reached in the bag we would've eaten some. Serves him right.
What are you some kind of tough guy?
Okay. Let's everybody just relax. Jerry, take the camera.
All right, I'm takin' the camera.
C'mon, let's go.
Oh man...
Hey man, so how was the rest of Death Blow?
How was the rest of Death Blow?
Yeah, who got the final Death Blow, 'cause I thought that Hawaiian guy had it comin' to him!

He's quite a character, isn't he?
You know, he came by here at 3 o'clock in the morning to pick up the tape. I was scared out of my mind!
I got it. Yep.
Brody.
Come on up. It's Brody.
What are you, crazy? I don't want to see this guy again.
Jerry, you did him a favor. He probably wants to come up and thank you.
What if I didn't do it right?
It's your first time. He'll understand.
People with guns don't understand. That's why they get guns. Too many

Hi.

Yeah.

May I use your phone?
Uh yeah. It's under the couch.
Look at you! You've got another gig!
I don't want another gig! I'm not doin' this.

Sure, do you need a glove?

What?

At Yankee Stadium?

He's not stocky.

Wha? Where?

Nah, he's not going to know the difference.

I don't care about Brody. I was up on 96th Street today, there was a kid couldn't have been more than ten years old. He was asking a street vendor if he had any other bootlegs as good as Death Blow. That's who I care about. The little kid who needs bootlegs, because his parent or guardian won't let him see the excessive violence and strong sexual content you and I take for granted.
So you'll do the movie?

Right here.

I have George Costanza still holding.

Pick up the phone, Elaine. Pick it up!
I never should have given Anna the impression--
Pick it up, pick it up!
--that you're a bad seed, I mean, you're a fine seed.

What?
You are ruinin' everything.

Kramer...
